newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Iona Technologies Q1 revenue up 145 pct to $9 mln.
newsitem.headline: Iona Technologies Q1 revenue up 145 pct to $9 mln.

text.p: Iona Technologies Plc, an Irish company quoted on NASDAQ, on Monday reported a 145 percent increase in total revenues to $9.1 million for the first quarter to March 30.
The company reported an increase of 31 percent in net income to $1.4 million, or $0.08 per share, up from $1.1 million or $0.07 per share in the corresponding period in 1996.
Chairman and chief executive Chris Horn said it has been an historic three months for Iona.
"Our first quarter on NASDAQ, along with the release of a number of notable new products and initiatives has marked a busy period in our history," Horn said.
He said the group was continuing to work hard to maintain its leadership in the object technology market.
Iona, formed in 1991, creates systems to integrate multiple, diverse software applications.
Its flagship product Orbix, allows organisations to build software components with open standard interfaces so that they can communicate with any other software conforming to the same standard.
"The company has performed well in the first quarter of this year with good growth in all our business areas," Mick Prokopis, chief financial officer said in a results statement.
He said Iona plans to continue to grow its business with aggressive spending on sales, marketing and research and development.
Iona reported total first quarter operating expenses of $5.6 million versus $1.8 million in the first quarter of 1996 and gross profit of $6.97 million up from $2.95 million.
